sentences.english: My grandma is very good at weaving baskets with bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 我的艿艿十分擅長用竹子編籃筐。

sentences.english: The coaches told me to dunk, but I would lay the ball in.
sentences.chinese: 教練要求我去灌籃，但我會把球輕輕的放進籃筐。

sentences.english: McCamey is quite adept at penetration and getting the foul calls near the basket.
sentences.chinese: 麥卡密擅長突破以及在籃筐附近造犯規。

sentences.english: Catch the basketball behind the three-point line and square up to the basket in the triple threat position.
sentences.chinese: 持球站在三分線外，面向籃筐，擺好三重威脅姿勢。

sentences.english: Thinks it is unrealistic to have him attack the basket as often as he did a. l. a earlier in his career.
sentences.chinese: 認爲期望他像職業生涯早期那樣攻擊籃筐不太現實。

sentences.english: If you could leap shoulder-high above the rim.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能跳得比籃筐還高。

sentences.english: He is tall enough to reach the basket.
sentences.chinese: 他個頭高，可以夠到籃筐。

sentences.english: In the fourth quarter he routinely posted up and burst past Kevin Garnett to finish at the rim.
sentences.chinese: 在第四節，他長驅直入，隔着加內特在籃筐上暴扣。

sentences.english: Halftime, Barry and Yao Ming in the basket at both ends of a two - thirds vote from the ball .
sentences.chinese: 中場休息時，巴里和姚明在籃筐的兩端投起了三分球。

sentences.english: "I'm thinking, 'I'm going to tear the frim off, " James answered.
sentences.chinese: “我想把這個該死的籃筐扯爛，”詹姆斯說。

sentences.english: He made a shot but the ball bounced off the basket.
sentences.chinese: 他投籃射門的球從籃筐彈出去。

sentences.english: Players who drive to the hoop also flop to the floor in hopes of drawing the whistle.
sentences.chinese: 那些衝向籃筐的進攻球員也會假摔來騙裁判吹哨。

sentences.english: Underthebasket, leaving him, fat malingerer figure.
sentences.chinese: 籃筐下，只留下他，肥子的身材。

sentences.english: If the ball rests on the edges, and the opponent moves the basket, it shall count as a goal.
sentences.chinese: 如果球停在筐沿，而防守方移動籃筐，也記爲進球。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
